vectorData.altText:
11. The eyes blink reflexively in response to touch. Which cranial nerve is responsible for the motor arm of this reflex?
Cranial nerve ___#____, the ____________ nerve.
(2 answers; separate with one space)
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right! CN VII, the facial nerve is motor to the muscles of facial expression, including the orbicularis oculi and obicularis oris.

That took care of 8 of the 12 cranial nerves; not so bad, so far! The last 4 are a little more complicated…. 
Largely general sensory:
cranial nerve V, the trigeminal nerve    , is sensory to the skin of the face. It consists of the ophthalmic, maxillary and mandibular subdivisions. 
the trigeminal nerve is also motor to the muscles of mastication; a lesion causes weakness in, and atrophy of, these muscles
cranial nerves VII, IX and X have small areas of general sensory responsibility, largely associated with the external ear and ear canal (VII and X) and the pharyngotympanic tube (IX)
The final three are pretty much a Mixed Bag:
cranial nerve VII, the facial nerve    , controls the muscles of facial expression; if lesioned, the ipsilateral face is weakened or paralyzed
the facial nerve also carries parasympathetic fibres destined to control secretion of the the lacrimal, submandibular and sublingual glands, as well as the mucosa of the nasal and oral cavities
the facial nerve receives taste from the anterior 2/3 of the tongue
as noted above, it carries general sensory fibres from portions of the external ear
cranial nerve IX, the glossopharyngeal nerve    , receives taste and general sensory fibres from the posterior 1/3 of the tongue
it also carries parasympathetic fibres destined to control secretion of the parotid gland
cranial nerve X, the vagus nerve    , carries parasympathetic fibres destined to supply thoracic and much of the abdominal viscera
it is motor to the muscles of the larynx (speech) and pharynx (swallowing); its lesioning causes a hoarse voice and dysphagia (difficulty swallowing)
Those of you who are, like me, a Gemini, recognize that “trigeminal” means “triplets”; the trigeminal nerve consists of three major subdivisions
Again, the name reflects the function of the nerve!
Here, the name reflects its distribution!
The name comes from the Latin word for “wanderer”; the vagus nerve wanders through the neck, thorax and abdomen
